Name: Norse
History: The Norse of old were a north Germanic people who hailed from Scandinavia. During the early Middle Ages their regions expanded to Russia, England, Iceland and Greenland. They traveled to Asia as well as to the New World nearly 500 years before Columbus. Though feared for their fighting skills, they were also skilled traders and sailors. By the end of the Viking Age, which lasted from 793-1066 AD, their raids on the mainland faded, nonetheless they have left their mark on European culture and history.

Technologies.Name: Clinker Construction
Technologies.History: This technique was developed by the Norse and is a method of boat-building where the edges of hull planks overlap. With this technology, boats could be made less heavy.

Heroes.Name: Erik the Red
Heroes.History: Erik Thorvaldsson, better known as Erik the Red because of his hair color, was the founder of the first Norse settlement in Greenland. His son was Leif Erikson, the famous explorer.

Heroes.Name: Ivar the Boneless
Heroes.History: Ivar the Boneless, son of Ragnar Lothbrok, was a Norse warlord and one of the commanders of the Great Heathen Army which invaded the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms of England. Later he founded the Uí Ímair dynasty, which dominated the Irish Sea during the Viking Age.

Heroes.Name: Hastein
Heroes.History: Hastein was a notable Norse Chieftain that made several raiding voyages during the late 9th century. He's particularly known for his raids in the Mediterranean area.

CivBonuses.Name: Gathering vs. Speed
CivBonuses.Description: The Citizen Soldiers are slow (-20%) gatherers, still they move faster than most infantry. (+10%)

CivBonuses.Name: Improved palisades
CivBonuses.Description: In exchange for having no stone walls they receive stronger palisades that cost more time to build.
